definition: child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law

sentences.english: His heart ached for the suffering child bride.
sentences.chinese: 他对那个受苦的童养媳十分同情。

sentences.english: Each grass is. a child bridegroom of an ox or a sheep. They have been bonded by marriage.
sentences.chinese: 每株草都是牛羊家族的童养媳，早有婚约在的。

sentences.english: However, who can know, this female general is child bride one's previous experience however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，谁能知道，这位女将军却是童养媳出身。

sentences.english: With the exception of the little girl they had adopted, none in the house could go to sleep that night.
sentences.chinese: 二诸葛家里除了童养媳之外，三个人谁也没有睡。

sentences.english: child brides sometimes set themselves on fire to escape arranged marriages.
sentences.chinese: 那些童养媳有时会通过自焚来逃避包办婚姻。

sentences.english: It is not surprising that child brides have a very high rate of suicide.
sentences.chinese: 童养媳率非常高，有自杀，这并不奇怪。

sentences.english: She was given to another family as a child bride.
sentences.chinese: 她被给了另一户人家作童养媳。

definition: to marry and live with the bride's family (inverting traditional Chinese expectations)
to go and live with one's wife's family, in effect becoming a member of her family
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
forced marriage/arranged marriage (without the consent of the individuals)
to live as widow/to observe widowhood
